The age range for defining: prime working years" was identified as 25 to 54, based on the input from several economists.
The: employment-to-population ratio" for ages 25 to 54 was calculated by dividing the percentage of people in that age range who are working by the total number of people in that age range.
The most recent data from the federal Bu: covering October 2016, showed that 78.2 percent of the population between 25 and 54 was working, indicating that 21.8 percent were not working.
Historical context was provided by compa: highlighting that the percentage of people working in this age range has steadily risen during President Barack Obama's presidency and is not significantly lower than the all-time high of 81.9 percent in April 2000.
